member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.FilterMemberType

member.value: The filter member data type of the column.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.OptimizeDistinctFilterQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to optimize distinct filter query.
member.remarks: By default, a condition of the form 'Member IsEqualTo Value' is generated for each distinct value selected and then all such conditions are combined with the OR operator. When the amount of distinct values checked grows, the query might become very slow. Setting OptimizeDistinctFilterQuery to true, will check the amount of distinct values checked. If this amount is less than or equal to half of all distinct values the original query will be generated. If, however, the amount of distinct values checked is more than half of all distinct values, an inverted statement like this be generated: (Member IsNotEqualTo uncheckedDistinctValue_0) ... AND ... (Member IsNotEqualTo uncheckedDistinctValue_N) If absolutely all distinct values are checked then no statement will be generated at all because this effectively means that there is no filter applied. Setting this property to true will try to generate the shortest possible LINQ Where clause.
member.value: A value indicating whether to optimize distinct filter query.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.FilteringDisplayFunc
member.summary: Gets the filtering display function.
member.remarks: This function is used by the filtering control distinct values list. It accepts a raw data value and returns what will become the content of the distinct value checkbox.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.TargetFilters
member.summary: Gets the FilterDescriptorCollection where this column will add its ColumnFilterDescriptor. By default these are the RadGridView.FilterDescriptors since the column is filtering RadGridView.
member.value: The FilterDescriptorCollection where this column will add its ColumnFilterDescriptor.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn.Header

member.remarks: The ElementName binding does not work when used in column Header or CellTemplate. The problem comes from the fact that binding engine uses FindName method on FrameworkElement to find the target just once. So when element is loaded with LoadContent() – the element is not yet in the visual tree and FindName fails. As a solution, you can apply a Style to set the ContentTemplate.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewHeaderCell.HookupGripperEvents
member.summary:
Find grippers and register drag events
The default style for DataGridHeader is +-------------------------------+ +---------+ +---------+ + Gripper + Header + Gripper + + + + + +---------+ +---------+ +-------------------------------+
The reason we have two grippers is we can't extend the right gripper to straddle the line between two headers; the header to the right would render on top of it. We resize a column by grabbing the gripper to the right; the leftmost gripper thus adjusts the width of the column to its left.

member.summary: ClearViewModel gripper events.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.IProvideStackingSize
member.summary: Allows pixel-based virtualization to ask an ItemsControl for the size of its header (if available) and a size estimate for its containers. This is used for MyTreeView virtualization.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.CleanupContainers(System.Int32,Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.BaseItemsControl)
member.summary: Immediately cleans up any containers that have gone off screen. Called by MeasureOverride. When recycling this runs before generating and measuring children; otherwise it runs after.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.SetVirtualizationState(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.BaseItemsControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Sets up IsVirtualizing.
IsVirtualizing is true if turned on via the items control and if the panel has a viewport. VSP has a viewport if it's either the scrolling panel or it was given MeasureData.
VSP can only make use of, create, and propagate down MeasureData if it is pixel-based, since the viewport is in pixels.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.AddFocusTrail(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.MeasureData)
member.summary: Extends the viewport of the given MeasureData to give a focus trail. Returns by how much it extended the viewport.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.AdjustViewportOffset(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.MeasureData,Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.IProvideStackingSize)
member.summary: Returns the MeasureData we'll be using for computations in MeasureOverride. This updates the viewport offset based on the one set in the MeasureData property prior to the call to MeasureOverride.

member.summary: Inserts a new container in the visual tree.

member.summary: Inserts a recycled container in the visual tree.

member.summary: Inserts a container into the Children collection. The container is either new or recycled.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.ContainerStackingSizeEstimate(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.IProvideStackingSize)
member.summary: Estimates a container size in the stacking direction for the given ItemsControl.
member.returns: The stacking size estimate.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.ExtendDesiredSize(System.Int32,System.Windows.Size,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: DesiredSize is normally computed by summing up the size of all items we've generated. Pixel-based virtualization uses a 'full' desired size. This extends the given desired size beyond the visible items. It will extend it by the items before or after the set of generated items. The given pivotIndex is the index of either the first or last item generated.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.AddContainerFromGenerator(System.Int32,System.Windows.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Takes a container returned from Generator.GenerateNext() and places it in the visual tree if necessary. Takes into account whether the container is new, recycled, or already realized.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.ChildIndexFromRealizedIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes an index from the realized list and returns the corresponding index in the Children collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.DisconnectRecycledContainers
member.summary: Recycled containers still in the Children collection at the end of Measure should be disconnected from the visual tree. Otherwise they're still visible to things like Arrange, keyboard navigation, etc.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.AdjustFirstVisibleChildIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called after 'count' items were removed or recycled from the Generator. _firstVisibleChildIndex is the index of the first visible container. This index isn't exactly the child position in the UIElement collection; it's actually the index of the realized container inside the generator. Since we've just removed some realized containers from the generator (by calling Remove or Recycle), we have to adjust the first visible child index.
member.param: Index of the first removed item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewVirtualizingPanel.NestedLayoutStrategy.RealizedChildren
member.summary: Returns the list of children that have been realized by the Generator. We must use this method whenever we interact with the Generator's index. In recycling mode the Children collection also contains recycled containers and thus does not map to the Generator's list.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewRowItem.SyncProperties
member.summary: Fired when the Row is attached to the GridViewDataControl. The scenario here is if the user is scrolling and the Row is a recycled container that was just added back to the visual tree. Properties that rely on a value from the Grid should be reevaluated because they may be stale.
member.remarks:
Properties can obviously be stale if the GridViewDataControl's value changes while the row is disconnected. They can also be stale for unobvious reasons.
For example, the Style property is invalidated when we detect a new Visual parent. This happens for elements in the row (such as the RowHeader) before Prepare is called on the Row. The coercion callback will thus be unable to find the GridViewDataControl and will return the wrong value.
There is a potential for performance work here. If we know a DP isn't invalidated when the visual tree is reconnected and we know that the Grid hasn't modified that property then its value is likely fine. We could also cache whether or not the Grid's property is the one that's winning. If not, no need to redo the coercion. This notification is pretty fast already and thus not worth the work for now.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.NotifyPropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs,Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.UpdateTarget)
member.summary: General notification for DependencyProperty changes from the grid or from columns.
member.remarks: This can be called from a variety of sources, such as from column objects or from this GridViewDataControl itself when there is a need to notify the rows and/or the cells in the GridViewDataControl about a property change. Down-stream handlers can check the source of the change using the "d" parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.GetDistinctValues(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the first 1000 distinct values for the given column.
member.param: A value indicating whether to filter the distinct values based on other columns' existing filters.
member.returns: An IEnumerable containing the distinct values.
member.remarks: The 'filter' parameter specifies whether distinct values should be filtered according to other columns' active filters. For example, if we have countries and players and we have filtered by CountryX, when we request all distinct players, if 'filter' is true we will get players from CountryX only. If 'filter' is false we will get all distinct players.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.GetDistinctValues(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns distinct values for a given column.
member.param: A value indicating whether to filter the distinct values base on other columns' existing filters.
The maximum amount of distinct values to return. If you specify null for this parameter, then all distinct values will be returned.
member.returns: An IEnumerable containing the distinct values.
member.remarks: The 'filter' parameter specifies whether distinct values should be filtered according to other columns' active filters. For example, if we have countries and players and we have filtered by CountryX, when we request all distinct players, if 'filter' is true we will get players from CountryX only. If 'filter' is false we will get all distinct players.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.ScrollIntoViewAsync(System.Object,System.Action{System.Windows.FrameworkElement},System.Action)
member.summary: Scrolls the row containing the data item into view in an asynchronous manner.
member.remarks: Since this method is asynchronous, calling it will return immediately. If you need to perform a certain action once the scrolling is done use the scrollFinishedCallback parameter to pass in a method to execute. The FrameworkElement parameter of this method will be the row that was just scrolled.
member.param: The data item to scroll into view.
The method to execute when scrolling has finished.
The method to execute when scrolling has failed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.RowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the row height for all rows.
member.value: The height of the rows, in device-independent units. The registered default is 25.
member.remarks: By default the grid rows are measured with NaN ("Auto" in XAML) height to make the row automatically adjust its size to fit its content. When you set a value for the RowHeight property, it must be equal to or greater than 0.0. Double.PositiveInfinity is not a valid value for this property. The value restrictions on the Double value are enforced by a ValidateValueCallback mechanism. If you attempt to set a value that is not valid, a run-time exception is thrown.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.GroupHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the group headers.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.ValidatesOnDataErrors
member.summary: Denotes in which mode RadGridView will perform data validation.
member.value: The default value is a combination between all modes (InViewMode and InEditMode).
member.remarks: This property will checks for errors that are raised by the IDataErrorInfo and INotifyDataErrorInfo implementation of the source object.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.ValidationType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what validation type should be processed by RadGridView.
member.value: The default value is a combination between all types (DataAnnotations, IDataErrorInfo and INotifyDataErrorInfo).

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether columns are created automatically when the ItemsSource property is set.
member.returns: true if the columns should be created automatically; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: You can modify the Columns collection at run time regardless of whether it contains generated columns. However, if you specify columns in XAML, you should set AutoGenerateColumns to false. If you want to modify auto-generated columns during generation you can use AutoGeneratingColumn event.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can edit the values in the control.
member.returns: true if the control is read-only; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: If the IsReadOnly property is set to true, none of the cells can enter editing mode. You can set this behavior for individual columns by setting the GridViewColumn.IsReadOnly property. If the DataGridColumn.IsReadOnly property and the GridViewColumn.IsReadOnly property are both set, a value of true will take precedence over a value of false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.RowStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the rows.
member.value: The style applied to rows. The default is null.
member.remarks: Whether defined as an inline style or as a resource, the Style defines the appearance of a row in the data grid, and should specify a TargetType of GridViewRow. You typically would specify setters for individual properties, and might also use a setter for the Template property if you wanted to change the composition of elements. For information that can help you decide whether to define styles inline or as resources, see Styles and Templates.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.CanUserReorderColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can change the column display order by dragging column headers with the mouse.
member.value: true if the user can reorder columns; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: You can set this behavior for individual columns by setting the GridViewColumn.IsReorderable property. If the GridViewColumn.IsReorderable property and the GridViewDataControl.CanUserReorderColumns property are both set, a value of false will take precedence over a value of true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.ShouldReorderColumnsOnUngrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can change the column display order by dragging group panel cells on column headers with the mouse.
member.value: true if the user can reorder columns; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.CanUserFreezeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the frozen column splitter is visible.
member.value: true if user can freeze columns; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.CanUserSortColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can sort columns by clicking the column header.
member.value: true if the user can sort columns; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: You can set this behavior for individual columns by setting the GridViewColumn.IsSortable property. If the GridViewColumn.IsSortable property and the GridViewDataControl.CanUserSortColumns property are both set, a value of false will take precedence over a value of true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.AutoExpandGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether groups should be expanded or not.
member.value: true if groups should be expanded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.CanUserResizeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can adjust column widths using the mouse.
member.value: true if the user can resize columns; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: You can set this behavior for individual columns by setting the GridViewColumn.IsResizable property. If the GridViewColumn.IsResizable property and the GridViewDataControl.CanUserResizeColumns property are both set, a value of false will take precedence over a value of true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.CanUserInsertRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can add new rows.
member.value: true if the user can add new rows; otherwise, false. The registered default is true.
member.remarks: When this property is set to true a blank row is displayed at the top of GridViewDataControl. A user can enter a new item into the blank row. Adding a new row adds an item to the ItemsSource. You can set default values for the new item by handling the AddingNewDataItem event and setting the values programmatically.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.CanUserDeleteRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can delete rows.
member.value: true if the user can add new rows; otherwise, false. The registered default is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewDataControl.Columns
member.summary: Gets a collection that contains all the columns in the control.
member.remarks: Use the Columns collection to add columns, remove columns, or update properties on the columns. Each column in the Columns collection defines a column in the GridViewDataControl. Columns in the collection must derive from GridViewColumn. GridViewDataColumn, which adds support for binding, derives from GridViewColumn and is the base for the defined column types.

member.summary: Gets or sets the standard width or automatic sizing mode of columns in the control.
member.value: A structure that represents the standard width or automatic sizing mode of columns in the DataGrid. The default is Auto.
member.remarks: By default, columns will automatically adjust their width to fit their contents. This property affects the width setting of every column in the control that does not have an explicit Width setting.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator
member.summary: An GridViewItemContainerGenerator is responsible for generating the UI on behalf of its host (e.g. BaseItemsControl). It maintains the association between the items in the control's data view and the corresponding UIElements. The control's item-host can ask the GridViewItemContainerGenerator for a Generator, which does the actual generation of UI.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.System#Windows#Controls#Primitives#IItemContainerGenerator#StartAt(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.GeneratorPosition,System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.GeneratorDirection)
member.summary: Begin generating at the given position and direction.
member.remarks: This method must be called before calling GenerateNext. It returns an IDisposable object that tracks the lifetime of the generation loop. This method sets the generator's status to GeneratingContent; when the IDisposable is disposed, the status changes to ContentReady or Error, as appropriate.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.DoLinearSearch(System.Windows.DependencyObject@,System.Object@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Performs a linear search.
member.remarks:
There's no avoiding a linear search, which leads to O(n^2) performance if someone calls ContainerFromItem or IndexFromContainer for every item. To mitigate this, we start each search at _startIndexForUIFromItem, and heuristically set this in various places to where we expect the next call to occur.
For example, after a successful search, we set it to the resulting index, hoping that the next call will query either the same item or the one after it. And after inserting a new item, we expect a query about the new item. Etc.
Saving this as an index instead of a (block, offset) pair, makes it more robust during insertions/deletions. If the index ends up being wrong, the worst that happens is a full search (as opposed to following a reference to a block that's no longer in use).
To re-use the search code for two methods, please read the description of the parameters.
member.param: If non-null, then searches for the container. Otherwise, updated with container for the item.
If non-null, then searches for the item. Otherwise, updated with the item that the container represents.
If a container or item is found, then updated with its index. Otherwise, set to -1.
member.returns: True if found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.Realize(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.UnrealizedItemBlock,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Realize the item in a block at the given offset, to be the given item with corresponding container. This means updating the item map data structure so that the item belongs to a Realized block. It also requires updating the state of every generator to track the changes we make here.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.MoveItems(Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.ItemBlock,System.Int32,System.Int32,Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.GridViewItemContainerGenerator.ItemBlock,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move 'count' items starting at position 'offset' in block 'block' to position 'newOffset' in block 'newBlock'. The difference between the cumulative item counts of newBlock and block is given by 'deltaCount'.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.GridView.ScrollData.ComputedOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed offset based on _offset set by the IScrollInfo methods. Set at the end of a successful Measure pass. This is the offset used by Arrange and exposed externally. Thus an offset set by PageDown via IScrollInfo isn't reflected publicly (e.g. via the VerticalOffset property) until a Measure pass.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadTreeListView.ScrollIntoViewAsync(System.Object,System.Action{System.Windows.FrameworkElement},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scrolls the row containing the data item into view in an asynchronous manner.
member.remarks: Since this method is asynchronous, calling it will return immediately. If you need to perform a certain action once the scrolling is done use the scrollFinishedCallback parameter to pass in a method to execute. The FrameworkElement parameter of this method will be the row that was just scrolled.
member.param: The item to scroll into view.
The method to execute when scrolling has finished.
Indicates whether to expand the item or not.
